<SectionDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### simplifyInstWithSCEV() {#a18d107c857f7c718310768ff5495cb2b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool UnrolledInstAnalyzer::simplifyInstWithSCEV (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I)</>}>
Try to simplify instruction.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="I">using its <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
The idea is that some AddRec expressions become constants, which then could trigger folding of other instructions. However, that only happens for expressions whose start value is also constant, which isn&#39;t always the case. In another common and important case the start value is just some address (i.e. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevunknown">SCEVUnknown</a>) - in this case we compute the offset and save it along with the base address instead.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-h/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-h">LoopUnrollAnalyzer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-cpp/#l00032">32</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-cpp">LoopUnrollAnalyzer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### visitBinaryOperator() {#afbd1d3926b9ab5f4e16ede4a58b4e5e9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool UnrolledInstAnalyzer::visitBinaryOperator (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binaryoperator">BinaryOperator</a> &amp; I)</>}>

TODO: Probably it&#39;s worth to hoist the code for estimating the simplifications effects to a separate class, since we have a very similar code in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/inlinecost">InlineCost</a> already.

### SimplifiedAddresses {#aec2ceb10706dd8e86c5109f54eb908da}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;Value &#42;, SimplifiedAddress&gt; llvm::UnrolledInstAnalyzer::SimplifiedAddresses</>}>
A cache of pointer bases and constant-folded offsets corresponding to GEP (or derived from GEP) instructions.

In order to find the base pointer one needs to perform non-trivial traversal of the corresponding <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression, so it&#39;s good to have the results saved.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-h">LoopUnrollAnalyzer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### SimplifiedValues {#a8b3599a508289306b24a222dcf12d4df}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;Value &#42;, Value &#42;&gt;&amp; llvm::UnrolledInstAnalyzer::SimplifiedValues</>}>
While we walk the loop instructions, we build up and maintain a mapping of simplified values specific to this iteration.

The idea is to propagate any special information we have about loads that can be replaced with constants after complete unrolling, and account for likely simplifications post-unrolling.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-h/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopunrollanalyzer-h">LoopUnrollAnalyzer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
